alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 3:10AM EST until December 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Coastal Bay and Coastal Gulf Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Friday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 1 PM EST this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Water levels will rise to between 1.5 ft and 2.5 ft mean higher high water, which will result in minor inundation of areas along the beachfront. At these levels, flooding affects areas near the Panama City Marina as well as beach access points in Panama City Beach. In addition to the coastal flood risk, there is a risk of high surf and rip currents. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
